ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient presents with seizures, intellectual disability, hypotonia, and EEG abnormalities similar to phenotypic features associated with Dravet syndrome.
This syndrome is associated with intellectual disability, growth delays, hypotonia, and distinctive facial features including low-set ears and microtia.
The combination of intellectual disability, distinctive facial features (thin upper lip vermilion, everted lower lip), and hypotonia aligns with the presentation of Smith-Lemli-Opitz syndrome.
Although common features include intellectual disability and autistic behavior, additional specific physical features align with Fragile X syndrome presentations.
